snippet: The West 69th Street Block Association has opposed renaming a portion of that street after Matthew P. Sapolin, who led the mayor’s office for the disabled until his death in late November.
abstract: West 69th Street Block Association in Manhattan rejects proposal to rename a portion of the street after Matthew P Sapolin, who was the city’s first commissioner of the Mayor’s Office for People With Disabilities until his death in November; street naming is still on the table, but other approaches may be considered, like attaching a plaque on his building that lays out aspects of his biography.
lead_paragraph: The West 69th Street Block Association has opposed renaming a portion of that street after Matthew P. Sapolin, who led the mayor’s office for the disabled until his death in late November.

headline.seo: West 69th Street Group Opposes Street Renaming
headline.main: Too Many Notable People to Name Street for Just One
headline.print_headline: Too Many Notable People To Name Street for Just One

keywords.value: Mayor's Office for People With Disabilities (NYC)
keywords.name: organizations
